content: I just test-deployed here #5608, which is a new emoji picker that's been worked on by various folks starting at PyCon. The hope is that we can get it debugged and merged before Zulip 1.7, so I'd appreciate a bunch of feedback as well as manual testing/QA looking for bugs (normal emoji, realm emoji, and the zulip emoji are all different cases in the code)
Paging through the sections with the keyboard is non-intuitive.
REALLY like it!! One thing: searched for smile cat and found but when I typed cat smile no results. It would be nice if space was functioning like an AND operator.
How does one page through the sections?
You don't. You try and get pulled back to the original position.
pageup/pagedown seem to do it?
Right I thought he meant something other than going through the grid by arrows.
As in there was a shortcut in particular for moving from one section to the top of the next.
seems like I am wrongly updating the scroll position. Will be easy to fix..
1st arrow 2nd page keys 3rd search
@Matthias Thanks for the feedback, I will try to add it. :)
page-down moves me through sections (highlighting the right thing at the bottom), but the cursor gets lost
Ahh, yeah, the cursor needs to move too.
yeah I was thinking about that too. Would moving the cursor to the first emoji in the section be good here?

Also, this is more of a usability thing than a bug, but after you page-down, we'll want to make the cursor super obvious so that you don't think the cursor is selecting the bottom row. (My intuition was to hit up arrow to go back to all the individual emojis).
Yea, that would work
another thing: it would be useful to have the tool tip show up when you are browsing through the emoji with the arrow keys.

This looks awesome! Some minor comments:

  • autocomplete: there are two :zulip:s in the compose typeahead, and only one in the emoji picker (not sure which is correct)
  • What is the sort order in the picker typeahead? slack keeps the category sort order, which I sort of like. Or maybe I'd prefer "exact matches first", "substring matches second", and within each group, sorted in the category order?
  • We should have title text over the icons at the bottom of the picker
  • I'm not sure thumbs_up is what I would use for "custom"? Though don't have a better idea off the top of my head.
  • For the popular emoji, maybe: ? Or maybe instead of ? I guess we have an opportunity here to set the types of reactions we want to make easy/normal to do.
A floating header for each of the sections would be nice.
Would love some suggestions regarding the icon for "Custom" category tab. Currently it is "thumbs_up". Here is the list of icons in font awesome icon set: http://fontawesome.io/icons/
Also suggestions for emojis in the Popular section would be welcome!
I suggest the gear/cog icon for custom (http://fontawesome.io/icon/cog/)
I think "thumbs_up" might actually be good for the "Popular" section, since it is the most popular emoji, and all the popular reactions are basically variations of thumbs up.
Yea, I feel like the clock means "Recent"
BTW, we've deployed @Harshit Bansal's new version of the emoji picker that fixes most of the issues discussed above. I'd appreciate a great deal of testing on this version as well!
Hopefully we're very close from being able to merge it.
I tried hitting ":" (to open the menu) and then pg-down, and my cursor was gone.

Some of the user facing improvements are as follows:
1: Improved search. Now, 'cat smile', 'smile cat', 'ca sm', 'sm ca' etc all will match 'cat_smile', 'cat_smiley' etc. (An improved version of what @Matthias had requested)
2: Fixed the search result order. (@Rishi Gupta )
3: Fixed the paging issues and updated the emoji categories tab icon.
Hmm, page-down seems to work fine for me cursor-wise.
Oh, maybe Steve means the cursor in the search box? That makes sense, because page-down is being used here to navigate among the choices with the keyboard...
Hmmm, I can't repro my problem, so maybe I didn't fully reload the first time.
@Steve Howell After pressing page-down you should be seeing the first emoji in the category highlighted and then you can use arrow keys to navigate further.
One I'm on the cursor, I kind of expect shift-tab to take me back to the textbox.
TAB will take you back to the textbox.
Though I agree SHIFT + TAB makes more sense
Yeah, making shift-tab work would be a good idea
Is emoji ordering in the popular section fine? Should we move :thumbs_up: before :simple_smile:?
yeah, agree with that change ( before )
and maybe at the end?
I think :tada:should also be moved before :simple_smile:?
yeah, that makes senes
(sorry for a bad initial guess at the order :))
I wish there were a nuanced set of , like "okay" vs "agree" vs "got it", but that's for V3 :).

I wish there were a nuanced set of , like "okay" vs "agree" vs "got it", but that's for V3 :).

Agree!
could be more like "got it," but I agree we could refine that later
I think this can be best achieved by attaching multiple names to the same emoji and preserving what user typed while displaying reaction.

I think there are two separate issues we may be talking about here:

  • It can be nice to find the same emoji with various synonyms (got it, okay, agree).
  • It can be nice to have different emojis for subtly different concepts. ("Thumbs up" is more of an agreement than simply "got it.")

I'm having a lot of trouble reproducing this on this server (I only got it one more time after spending a few minutes trying to make it happen again) and have not gotten it to happen in dev after a few minutes of trying.
Must have been something random/local; I'll let you know if it happens again or if there's some deterministic thing that makes it happen.
I will also try to reproduce on a windows machine. :)

Doesn't really make sense from a CSS issue. z-index values don't work in a way that would allow that to happen (given that the emojis are inside the popover, and the popover has a white background, it's impossible for the text behind to sneak between those two layers and be visible).

Looks like Chrome hiccuping.
I just noticed that pressing enter doesn't select the first emoji.
Like for example, I search for "laugh" and press enter, but it doesn't automatically select the first emoji.
confirmed ^^^
Hmm, yeah, @Harshit Bansal that last item is a bug we should prioritize.
I think that might be the main regression reported so far? Didn't double-check super carefully, so someone should.

re the most used/popular emoijs. Are they hard coded or dynamically generated?
I definitely prefer dynamic lists of most frequent emoijs. We have a few custom ones that are often used and should be in pole position.
They're hard coded for now.
We should probably move the custom ones at least to 2nd page, since I think they'll tend to be more common than most other emojis.

what about also adding most often used emoijs to the stats page? It's a bit of trivia, I know but stats are done in certain intervals which would also be enough for dynamically getting popular emoijs in the future.

We can probably already determine popular emojis with a simple database query.

I think there are some challenges with making the top 5 too dynamic:

  • If you change the top five too quickly for people, it can feel inconsistent and random to some users.
  • If you change the top five too slowly, you can get stuck with emojis for a while that really aren't long-term popular but just had a spike during a certain interval.

Would you want the top five to be set on a per-user basis, or are you thinking more for the entire organization?
How many custom emojis does your org have?

good question! both are valid options. I think per user makes more sense though. I know that some on our server like to send total random ones like or (lol). If they do that often it should reflect in their personal popular emoij list.
oh, more than 120
@Matthias I certainly have plans to make popular emoji list dynamic on a per user basis. It will be done once we are done with releasing 1.7.
The latest version deployed contains fixes for the major short-term issues discussed here (aka everything but dynamic listing). More testing appreciated!
Just bumping the visibility of this; I'd really love to get more feedback on this, because I think it's nearly ready to merge.
I like it a lot, and am looking forward to implementing almost exactly the same thing in the mobile app.

The only thing that can be improved is to have more sane 'Popular' list, possibly another line, and do add the Facebook reaction icons and few that are data mined from what we have already used here. I don't think actual dynamic 'popular' list is needed.
Yeah, that seems like a fine follow-up we can do once the infrastructure is merged :)

I also think it's great. A few things, none of which should block merging:

  • One follow-up could be to have the name of the emoji appear somewhere (other than the title text) when you hover or move the selector box over it. Currently I find myself hovering over the emoji, waiting for the title text, and it also makes it feel less usable from the keyboard.
  • I think the title text of the emoji in the emoji picker could be full moon rather than :full_moon:.
  • If it's easy, typing could bring focus back to the text box (e.g. if you press down-arrow and then type)

OK, I went ahead and merged this, since I think at this point we're definitely going to be fixing forward, and it'll be easier to continue that iteration with it already merged. @Rishi Gupta can you make sure the feedback here gets turned into some combination of issues and PRs addressing things? Also @Harshit Bansal FYI.
I guess the popular emoji issue is #4907.
sure. Harshit, do you think you'll be working on the followups (in which case I'll open them all as one issue), or will others (in which case I can open one for each)?
I'd do one for each regardless; some may be quicker than others.

I don't think actual dynamic 'popular' list is needed.

@Boris Yankov I definitely agree with rethinking the current popular group but not so much with not having dynamic popular lists. We use a lot of custom emoijs because the Android set that Zulip comes with isn't particularly pretty or clear.

My suggestion would be to have dynamic lists which are updated with the /stats or even less frequently (once a week - once a month) to reduce server load. This Zulip server won't necessarily reflect every other Zulip server either - here are developers and it's a community. We are a company with few devs etc.

Another example is that I use TightVNC for remote support and because I don't want to type it all the time I use a custom emoij of the icon. That's my personal, most used 'emoij' and it would only appear natural if it's listed under popular for me.
Good points.
Regarding server load I think this feature can be implemented on a per user basis using the local storage only just like we do for drafts. This would not require server intervention.
Server load is immaterial for this sort of thing; I'd rather have this sort of state be managed server-side so users don't lose state if they switch computers.
one thing I just noticed: the emoji picker doesn't currently accept the alternate emoji names (e.g. our compose typeahead accepts :date: and :calendar:, but the picker only accepts one)
Hmm, that's probably a regression?
That's actually not a regression.
Earlier there were two copies of the same emoji with different name.
Attaching multiple names to the same emoji will solve this problem.
Ahh, OK.

Feedback from one of our user communities:

It has categories now!!!!! Very happy about this, pass my congratulations on to those who worked on it @Tim Abbott :)
I feel like the search has been not as great. When I search tad for :tada:, it shows me :stadium: first.
For something like that we could do a regex rule like /^{{expression}}/ > /{{expression}}/.
Or check if the starting strIndex == 0.
Hmm, yeah, the sorting seems wrong. We do that correctly in typeahead; I wonder if we can make them share code. @Joshua Pan can you open an issue?

currently the order in the emoji picker is the category sort order. One proposal could be:

  • first sort by (prefix, prefix of later word in emoji name, substring)
  • within each group, search by "display order", by which I mean the current sort order + the "Popular" section on top

(I think the second bullet we should do regardless of whether we do the first)
I thought we always sorted by prefix for search
@Joshua Pan It does vary a bit from feature to feature what the best way to do things is.
Well, really, we want a different sort order once you search vs. without search.

fwiw, slack also does category sort order:
pasted image
One way to deal with things like this, where preserving the original sort order has some advantages, is to make the filter less aggressive when it starts getting enough prefix-only matches.
I think we do something roughly like that in one of our typeaheads.

Harshit's original PR sorted it the way our typeahead sorts, and we actually switched it to the current order (I think at my request).

A list of 20 emoji (without names, in the emoji picker) is hard to parse, and I think keeping it a "consistent" order (all the faces together, all the animals together, etc) helps a lot
slack also does Steve's proposal, in their compose typeahead

a minor thing: I've found myself typing "left arrow" several times to try to get to later emoji in the list. If it is not too hard, perhaps "left arrow" could do the same thing as "down arrow" (or maybe the same thing as "down arrow followed by left arrow") if the cursor is at the end of the input box?

another more major thing is that the emoji popover seems to typically pop to the side for me, rather than down. This is even when it feels like there is a lot of room. Is this intentional?

• The popover location is definitely a regression. @Harshit Bansal can you investigate?
  • I don't understand your comment about keys. Oh, maybe you mean "right arrow"?
oops, I did mean right arrow
Yeah, that seems like a fine change.

Opened PR #6277 for navigation changes. For popover placement issue, @Jack Zhang had made changes related to that code and he has specifically given priority to 'left/right' over 'top/bottom' positions. So before fixing that I would like to know if there is specific reason for prioritizing 'left/right' over 'top/bottom'. I think we can extend the function be having an extra argument specifying the preferred positioning.
@Harshit Bansal yeah, add an extra argument. I think that preference just came from the fact that the several popovers he tested were all ones where we wanted right/left.
okay will do it today.

The behavior is already implemented in message controls

anim.gif
We merged a few bug fixes for the emoji picker, including something to support aliases in emoji names (e.g. both +1 and thumbsup find the same emoji via search in the picker).
I've deployed here, would love it if a few folks played around with it looking for bugs :)
there are no more country flags?
I don't believe there's an intentional change there. @Harshit Bansal do you know what's up?
it use to be that would be a blue letter in type ahead and a flag in reactions. But now that there are aliases the flags probably got dropped?
It would be really nice to have the good emoji picker when I'm typing a message and hit : and try typing names.

Today for the Nth time I was trying to find the right emoji for something, an emoji I was pretty sure existed in the world, and frustrated at the limitations of trying to guess parts of the name and get 5 candidates at a time.

I was actually going to come here and ask what the status was of the fancy emoji picker I'd heard about and seen screenshots of, and whether it was going to ship soon / whether anyone was still working on it / what it was blocked on. Or maybe it was only available for emoji reactions? And it sure would be nice to have it for messages too.

Then, because I'm part of this community and have heard so often and so long ago about the fancy emoji picker, I thought: maybe it's here somewhere, just hidden away. So I looked harder around the UI, and promptly saw the smiley icon in the row under the compose box, and tried that and it worked.

But if I were a user that didn't have that pretty specific background knowledge, I'm pretty sure I would have assumed the emoji picker I was looking at was the one there was, and Zulip just had a primitive emoji picker.
(Once I got to it, the fancy emoji picker is very nice!)

I think the best version of this I've seen is how it's done by our main chat competitor. I don't know how hard that is to implement, though.
One simple thing that might help is increasing our typeahead to 6 or 8 rows, instead of 5.
Another thing in flight (not sure the current status) is adding more alternate names for the emoji, which would also help with this issue.
Yeah, that would -- it'd also help even with the fancy picker :)

re: fancy picker vs typeahead: I think the fancy picker is nice when you're browsing, but if you basically know what emoji you want, I think the typeahead interface is nicer.
E.g. dropbox paper does the "open a fancy picker when you type :" solution, and I think I like it less than the competing typeahead interfaces.

I think I often know what emoji I want but am not sure of its name. For example, the one I was looking for today was the face with downcast eyes: :disappointed: Whose name turns out to be :disappointed:, but that wasn't among the possible names I thought of.
agreed. I think @Harshit Bansal is the one most likely to know the current state with the names.
@Rishi Gupta by this, do you mean the names migration?
yeah

Ha, of course now that I see this thread on my phone, the emoji I mentioned above looks quite different -- much more like the name "disappointed", and doesn't really convey what I intended the other day in the thread that caused me to go look for it.

Kind of a classic emoji problem.

We're now using the "new" version of the Google emojiset (and more generally the emoji categories). There's an open PR to improve the sort order in the emoji picker, but I figure I should post here for feedback on how folks feel about the new Google emoji set style, since it looks significantly different (e.g. the smileys are now all round).
I like the round shapes better than the blobs, which was kind of an idiosyncratic choice in the old design.

Browsing through the picker a bit, most of the emoji look great.

My impression of the new emoji in seeing them around the app tonight is mostly formed by the few most common of them, though -- and :smile: and :smiley: both look kind of grotesquely exaggerated.

Hmm, I guess I don't mean :smile: . But :smiley: definitely, and I feel like there was another one I saw like that. ... aha, :big_smile: .

:grinning: is actually a less emphatic smile than :smiley: , which is odd.
(deleted)

Apart from what Tim mentioned, one more thing to notice is that the name change PR that Rishi was talking about in previous messages is now deployed here. So would love to hear from folks here if it improves their search experience.

Also, please keep track of if you ever type for an emoji name and have a bad experience, e.g.

  • you type an emoji name and it doesn't exist
  • you don't like the typeahead results for another reason

It's pretty easy to add new emoji names now.

New emojis definitely look a bit weird :joy:
Guess I'll get used to it ¯\_(ツ)_/¯

Hmm, interesting. I can confirm the issue; it appear that our static asset pipeline is renaming the emoji image files.
(And so we're getting an old version served to the web)
I'll open an issue.
Also, when I'm changing Emoji style in my display settings, the Saving button just keeps on loading, it never actually "Saved"

@Joshua Pan This may be caused by slow network speed. Actually on changing the emojiset we need to load some spritesheets which are quite big and the indicator doesn't change until it finishes downloading them.
we could possibly add a note to the save area? Something like Saving .. (may take a few minutes on a slow network.)
Actually due to copyright issues we are actually disabling support for changing emojisets so that feature will be going away soon :sad:. I have a PR almost ready for doing so.

and less as well.
for example :stuck_out_tongue: ( :stuck_out_tongue: ) is actually the one with the closed eyes, which is the correct name I guess?

I haven't been really following the emoji discussion but is there any possible way we can change : ) without the space to being a simple smile. I can't stand how obnoxious the one that shows up looks ( Sorry for the rant )
@Armaan Ahluwalia by that, you mean you prefer :smile: over :smiley: ?
No i mean i prefer :slight_smile: over :smiley:
I meant to say slight smile. Emoji names are very hard to remember!

Yeah, agree, that's a lot better. The code change is just this:

 # Emoticons and which emoji they should become. Duplicate emoji are allowed.
 # Changes here should be mimicked in `templates/zerver/help/enable-emoticon-translations.md`.
 EMOTICON_CONVERSIONS = {
-    ':)': ':smiley:',
-    '(:': ':smiley:',
+    ':)': ':slight_smile:',
+    '(:': ':slight_smile:',
     ':(': ':slight_frown:',
     '<3': ':heart:',
     ':|': ':expressionless:',

plus reprovisioning and doing test changes. @Harshit Bansal do you have time to take care of this?

While looking at that list: am I right that :slight_frown: and :frown: are aliases?

If so, just plain :frown: seems like the better name to translate the emoticon to.
(I'm guessing they're aliases because not only are the glyphs hard to distinguish -- but the full-blown emoji picker seems to show just one.)
Maybe we can compile a list of people’s requested changes and then I can quickly put in a PR
Yeah, they're aliases; I think they weren't aliases in the data set at the time when we created the emoticons feature, and so it's sorta the same issue as the smileys.
@Tim Abbott Opened #10069 for addressing this.

Does this (or other related changes) explain why a message had :thumbs_up: and :+1: as reactions? I used '+' and got the latter, I think, but thought that previously it gave the former - or at least assumed they would combine into one smiley.
Yes, @Harshit Bansal can you investigate? I'm guessing we just need to change the default name for the hotkey to match the default alias for the reaction.
I was also intrigued by this, since I implemented a minimal '+' hotkey for zulip-terminal, and it made me second-guess it.
I submitted #10112 for fixing this temporarily but this is not a longer-term solution. I will work on a permanent fix soon.
